It was the anniversary of the death of Mr Ling-kit Leung yesterday.

I have posted a song with both English and Chinese versions - The Fools Who Dream on my channel yesterday.

The song is originally from La La Land, and it is a song about dreaming. I wanted to use this song to trace back to some of the most sentimental, moving moments to me throughout the movement, and share them with you all in my singing, my revised lyrics and my video. I don’t sing well, but I just wanted to make it as a reflection to self, and a gift to whoever can see these videos.

This might be what a revolution is - we would smile, we would be in tears; and we might not win, in fact very likely losing, but at least I have had this beautiful dream with you all fools.

Dedicated to y’all: The Fools Who Dream.
I am honoured to go for this dream with you all.

//

English lyrics:

She used to live in Hong Kong
I remember, she used to come home and she would tell me
the fight for Freedom and democracy
I remember she told that she got hit by tear gas once, barefaced
She cried

Left, and still panting
And withdrew behind the fence
Had trouble in breathing
She spent a day sneezing
But said she would do it again

Here's to the ones who dream
Foolish as they may seem
Here's to the hearts that ache
Here's to the mess we make

She captured a feeling
A fight with no ending
Her family inside a frame
He leaped in the yellow
Died for the fellow
I'll always remember his name

Here's to the ones who dream
Foolish as they may seem
Here's to the hearts that ache
Here's to the mess we make
She told me

"A bit of madness is key
To give us new colours to see
Who knows where it will lead us?
And that's why they need us"

So bring on the rebels
The ripples from pebbles
They protest in exchange for peace

And here's to the fools who dream
Crazy as they may seem
Here's to the hearts that break
Here's to the mess we make

I trace it all back to then
Her, and the smoke, and the fence
Crying through it
She said she'd do it again

English lyrics:

She used to live in Hong Kong
I remember, she used to come home and she would tell me
the fight for Freedom and democracy
I remember she told that she got hit by tear gas once, barefaced
She cried

Left, and still panting
And withdrew behind the fence
Had trouble in breathing
She spent a day sneezing

Here's to the ones who dream
Foolish as they may seem
Here's to the hearts that ache
Here's to the mess we make

She captured a feeling

Here's to the ones who dream
Foolish as they may seem

Here's to the mess we make

The ripples from pebbles

And here's to the fools who dream
Crazy as they may seem
Here's to the hearts that break
Here's to the mess we make

Her, and the smoke, and the fence
Crying through it
She said she'd do it again

English lyrics:

She used to live in Hong Kong
I remember, she used to come home and she would tell me
the fight for Freedom and democracy
I remember she told that she got hit by tear gas once, barefaced
She cried

Left, and still panting
And withdrew behind the fence
Had trouble in breathing
She spent a day sneezing
But said she would do it again

Here's to the ones who dream
Foolish as they may seem
Here's to the hearts that ache
Here's to the mess we make

She captured a feeling
A fight with no ending
Her family inside a frame
He leaped in the yellow
Died for the fellow
I'll always remember his name

Here's to the ones who dream
Foolish as they may seem
Here's to the hearts that ache
Here's to the mess we make
She told me

"A bit of madness is key
To give us new colours to see
Who knows where it will lead us?
And that's why they need us"

So bring on the rebels
The ripples from pebbles
They protest in exchange for peace

And here's to the fools who dream
Crazy as they may seem
Here's to the hearts that break
Here's to the mess we make

I trace it all back to then
Her, and the smoke, and the fence
Crying through it
She said she'd do it again
